title: Are you a student?
description: This sign language sign would ask if someone is a student.

title: Are you deaf?
description: This sign language sign would inquire if someone is deaf.

title: Are you hungry?
description: This sign language sign would ask if someone is hungry.

title: Are you learning sign language?
description: This sign language sign would ask if someone is learning sign language.

title: Are your parents Deaf?
description: This sign language sign would ask if someone's parents are Deaf.

title: Can you (please) sign slower?
description: This sign language sign would request someone to sign more slowly.

title: Can you (please) sign that again?
description: This sign language sign would ask for a repetition of the sign.

title: Can you fingerspell that again?
description: This sign language sign would request a repetition of the fingerspelling.

title: Can you read lips?
description: This sign language sign would ask if someone can read lips.

title: Do you understand?
description: This sign language sign would ask if the person understands.

title: Good afternoon
description: This sign language sign would greet someone in the afternoon.

title: Good morning
description: This sign language sign would greet someone in the morning.

title: Goodbye
description: This sign language sign would be used to say goodbye.

title: Goodnight
description: This sign language sign would be used to say goodnight.

title: How are you?
description: This sign language sign would ask someone how they are.

title: How did you get here?
description: This sign language sign would ask someone about their mode of transportation.

title: How did you lose your hearing?
description: This sign language sign would inquire about the cause of someone's hearing loss.

title: How was your weekend?
description: This sign language sign would ask someone about their weekend.

title: I don’t understand.
description: This sign language sign would express a lack of understanding.

title: I have a question.
description: This sign language sign would be used to indicate that the signer has a question.

title: I have to go home.
description: This sign language sign would be used to indicate that the signer needs to go home.

title: I took the bus to get to class.
description: This sign language sign would describe taking the bus to class.

title: I want to introduce you to my friend Julie.
description: This sign language sign would be used to introduce a friend named Julie.

title: I’ll be right back.
description: This sign language sign indicates the speaker will return shortly.

title: I’m studying to be an interpreter.
description: This sign language sign expresses that the speaker is training to become an interpreter.

title: I’m taking ASL classes.
description: This sign language sign communicates that the speaker is currently enrolled in ASL classes.

title: Is that right?
description: This sign language sign is used to confirm the accuracy of a statement or question.

title: Is that true?
description: This sign language sign queries the veracity of a statement or piece of information.

title: Let me know.
description: This sign language sign requests to be informed or updated about a matter.

title: My name is Tobi (name sign).
description: This sign language sign is used to introduce the speaker's name as Tobi.

title: Nice to meet you.
description: This sign language sign is used to express pleasure in meeting someone.

title: No, I’m not deaf, I’m hearing.
description: This sign language sign clarifies that the speaker does not have hearing loss.

title: See you later.
description: This sign language sign is used to say goodbye for now, with the implication of meeting again.

title: Sorry, I already have plans.
description: This sign language sign is used to politely decline an invitation due to prior commitments.

title: Take care of yourself.
description: This sign language sign is a parting gesture wishing someone well in their health and activities.

title: There is no sign for that, you need to fingerspell it.
description: This sign language sign indicates that there is no specific sign for a word, and it must be fingerspelled.

title: What are you doing?
description: This sign language sign asks someone about their current activity or actions.

title: What did you/they say?
description: This sign language sign asks for a repetition or clarification of what was said.

title: What do you think?
description: This sign language sign solicits the opinion or thoughts of the person being addressed.

title: What does that mean?
description: This sign language sign asks for the meaning or explanation of something.

title: What is your name?
description: This sign language sign is used to ask someone their name.

title: What is your phone number?
description: This sign language sign asks someone for their phone number.

title: What is your teacher’s name?
description: This sign language sign inquires about the name of someone's teacher.

title: What time is it?
description: This sign language sign asks for the current time.

title: What time?
description: This sign language sign also asks for the current time, often used in a context where the time is already being discussed.

title: What’s wrong?
description: This sign language sign expresses concern and asks if there is an issue or problem.

title: Where are you learning sign language?
description: This sign language sign asks someone about the location where they are learning sign language.

title: Where do you live?
description: This sign language sign inquires about someone's place of residence.

title: Where do you work?
description: This sign language sign asks about someone's workplace.

title: Where is the bathroom?
description: This sign language sign is used to ask for the location of the bathroom.

title: Who is your teacher?
description: This sign language sign asks for the name of someone's teacher.

title: Why are you learning sign language?
description: This sign language sign inquires about the reasons behind someone learning sign language.

title: Would you like to go to dinner with me on Saturday?
description: This sign language sign is an invitation to go out for dinner on a specified day.

title: Write it please.
description: This sign language sign requests someone to write down the information.

title: Write notes back and forth.
description: This sign language sign suggests exchanging notes back and forth.

title: Yes, please.
description: This sign language sign is a polite affirmation or agreement.

title: Yes, thank you.
description: This sign language sign expresses affirmative gratitude.

title: You sign very fluently.
description: This sign language sign compliments someone on their fluent signing.

title: You’re welcome.
description: This sign language sign is a polite response to thanks.
